Class LedgerAdapter

java.lang.Object
net.tangly.erp.ledger.ports.LedgerAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.tangly.core.domain.Port<LedgerRealm>, LedgerPort
public class LedgerAdapter extends Object implements LedgerPort
Provide workflows for ledger activities.
  • Import of the ledger account structure. If using the banana application, select all definition rows in the accounts tab and export it as Data/Export Rows/Export Rows to Txt. Once completed you can use for example MacOs Numbers to remove company specific information such as segments.
  • Import transaction journal into the ledger. If using the banana application, select all transaction rows in the accounts tab and export it as Data/Export Rows/Export Rows to Txt.

    • exportLedgerDocument

      public void exportLedgerDocument(String name, LocalDate from, LocalDate to, boolean withBalanceSheet, boolean withProfitsAndLosses, boolean withEmptyAccounts, boolean withTransactions, boolean withVat, String text, Collection<net.tangly.core.Tag> tags, @NotNull @NotNull net.tangly.core.domain.DomainAudit audit)
      Description copied from interface: LedgerPort
      Exports a ledger report with profits and losses, and assets and liabilities information for a specific time interval.
      Specified by:
      exportLedgerDocument in interface LedgerPort
      Parameters:
      name - name of the document
      from - start of the time interval relevant for the report
      to - end of the time interval relevant for the report
      withBalanceSheet - flag indicating if the balance sheet information should be part of the report
      withProfitsAndLosses - flag indicating if the profits and losses information should be part of the report
      withEmptyAccounts - flag indicating if empty accounts should be part of the report
      withTransactions - flag indicating if the transactions should be part of the report
      withVat - flag indicating if VAT information should be part of the report
      text - text to be included in the document
      tags - tags to be associated with the document
      audit - audit information for the document

    • computeSegments

      public Collection<LedgerPort.Segment> computeSegments(@NotNull @NotNull String code, LocalDate from, LocalDate to)
      Description copied from interface: LedgerPort
      Computes all segments of a code for a specific time interval.

      If the transaction is VAT relevant, the effective amount is used to compute the amount.

      Specified by:
      computeSegments in interface LedgerPort
      Parameters:
      code - the code for which the segments should be computed. Examples are project and segment.
      from - start of the time interval relevant for the report
      to - end of the time interval relevant for the report
      Returns:
      the list of segments for the code in the time interval
